bitfield.description: Counter enable (MC_CNT_EN) 0: The benchmark counter is disabled. 1: The benchmark counter is enabled.
Counter reset (MC_CNT_RST) Writing 0 results in no effect. Writing 1 results in clearing the benchmark counter to 0. Always read as 0.
Counter value (MC_COUNT). Indicates current value of the benchmark counter. When MC_CNT_EN is 1 and IP is busy (en = 1), the benchmark counter counts up based on clk_mc. Writing has no effect.
H.264 MBAFF debug mode bit (MC_DBG). This bit is used for H.264 MBAFF mode only. For the other codecs, this bit must be 0. 0: Normal mode 1: Debug mode(1MB prediction/step)
Module start and status (MC_EN). Writing 1 starts a set of commands, and writing 0 is ignored. Writing to this register is forbidden while MC_EN = 1. 0: Idle 1: Busy
VC-1 sample mode 0: Bilinear Interpolation 1: Bicubic Interpolation
Codec_type select 0: H.264 2: VC-1 4: MPEG-4 5: MPEG-2 6: AVS-1.0 8: RealVideo-8/9/10 9: On2 VP6 10: On2 VP7

register.description: Base address of reference data Luma L0

bitfield.description: Base address of reference data Y L0 bottom (BASE_YREF_BOT_L0_ADD) (Reference for bottom field)
Base address of reference data Y L0 top (BASE_YREF_TOP_L0_ADD) (Reference for progressive/top field)

register.description: Base address of reference data Luma L1

bitfield.description: Base address of reference data Y L1 bottom (BASE_YREF_BOT_L1_ADD) (Reference for bottom field)
Base address of reference data Y L1 top (BASE_YREF_TOP_L1_ADD) (Reference for progressive/top field)

register.description: Base address of reference data chroma L0

bitfield.description: Base address of reference data C L0 bottom (BASE_CREF_BOT_L0_ADD) (Reference for bottom field)
Base address of reference data C L0 top (BASE_CREF_TOP_L0_ADD) (Reference for progressive/top field)
Base address of reference data C L1 bottom (BASE_CREF_BOT_L1_ADD) (Reference for bottom field)
Base address of reference data C L1 top (BASE_CREF_TOP_L1_ADD) (Reference for progressive/top field)
